abstract.p: Amazon.com chairman Jeff Bezos uses his mother's wish list for demonstration at PC Expo in New York, to show how easy it is for friends to order gifts online (M)

block.p: Jeff Bezos has found a straight man for his presentations. Or woman. Her name is Jackie Bezos, a k a Mom. At last week's PC Expo in New York, Mr. Bezos displayed her wish list, online at Amazon.com, to show how easy it was for friends to order appropriate gifts. A Casio camera for $999.99? ''Let her buy it herself,'' Mr. Bezos said.
But seeing that she also wanted Motorola's palm-sized walkie talkies at $109.99 each, he clicked and ordered one. ''You have to get two of them,'' a member of the audience hollered.

At last week's PC Expo in New York, Mr. Bezos displayed her wish list, online at Amazon.com, to show how easy it was for friends to order appropriate gifts. A Casio camera for $999.99? ''Let her buy it herself,'' Mr. Bezos said.
But seeing that she also wanted Motorola's palm-sized walkie talkies at $109.99 each, he clicked and ordered one. ''You have to get two of them,'' a member of the audience hollered.
''That's a great point,'' he responded, ordering a second one. ''My mother is forever grateful to you.''

Just days after an analyst questioned the ability of Amazon.com to make a profit, several questioners jerked Mr. Bezos's attention away from his mother's wants and toward investors'. ''We've been called Amazon.con, Amazon.toast, Amazon.bomb and, my personal favorite, Amazon.org,'' Mr. Bezos said. ''But I will tell you that no company cares more about profitability.''
